cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.PR, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the spectral gap of Markov chains, which is a topic in probability theory and has applications in various areas of computer science such as information theory (cs.IT), data structures (cs.DS), machine learning (cs.LG), probabilistic reasoning (cs.PR), and complexity theory (cs.CC). The specific application of the results to biased permutations suggests a connection to algorithms and combinatorics, which further supports the relevance of these sub-categories.
